questions.text: A 28-year-old female patient presents with progressive weakness, sensory disturbances, and difficulty with coordination. The patient is diagnosed with a demyelinating disorder, likely multiple sclerosis. Which one of the following statement is correct so as to consider it for managing the disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Autoantibodies against MBP and MOG enhance myelin production, leading to neurological symptoms.

options.label: B
options.text: The presence of autoantibodies indicates a protective immune response against demyelination.

options.label: C
options.text: Autoantibodies against MBP and MOG contribute to the demyelination.

options.label: D
options.text: Mutations in neuronal membrane proteins cause autoimmune reactions

questions.correct_answer: C. Autoantibodies against MBP and MOG contribute to the demyelination.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Autoantibodies against MBP and MOG contribute to the demyelination.

questions.text: While analyzing the impact of acute blood loss on cardiac function by interpreting changes in the Frank-Starling curves. Understanding how various clinical interventions or pathophysiological states affect stroke volume is vital. Given the patient's condition of Severe hemorrhage and the associated uncompensatory shock, to which point will the stroke volume shift from point X on the graph?

In a 45-year-old patient with a sudden-onset speech disorder, further investigations reveal a lesion in the left hemisphere involving the superior temporal gyrus and the posterior part of the left frontal lobe. The patient exhibits difficulty repeating spoken words without a corresponding impairment in language comprehension or production. Which intricate white matter tract is likely affected in this case?

A 30-year-old female patient experiencing irregular menstrual cycles and seeking guidance from her healthcare provider. During the healthcare team explores factors influencing reproductive hormone regulation. Which of the following have a role in controlling the secretion of Prolactin?

In a patient with chronic gastritis and peptic ulcer disease, it is important to understand the role of specific stomach cells. Which factor is primarily associated with enterochromaffin-like (ECL) cells of the stomach, and how does it contribute to the patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Histamine, which stimulates gastric acid production, potentially exacerbating ulcer symptoms.

options.label: B
options.text: Gastrin, which promotes mucus production and provides protection against ulcers.

options.label: C
options.text: Pepsinogen, an enzyme involved in protein digestion within the stomach.

options.label: D
options.text: Secretin, a hormone that regulates pancreatic enzyme secretion, influencing digestion.

questions.correct_answer: A. Histamine, which stimulates gastric acid production, potentially exacerbating ulcer symptoms.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Histamine, which stimulates gastric acid production, potentially exacerbating ulcer symptoms.

questions.text: Which of the following neurons predominantly fire during forceful expiration during exercise?

In a volunteer, 10 grams of mannitol was injected into the venous blood. At equilibrium, the urinary excretion of mannitol was found to be 10% and the plasma concentration of mannitol was measured at 60 mg/dl. Calculate the extracellular fluid (ECF) volume based on this information.
A man inspires 1000 ml from a spirometer. The intrapleural pressure was −4 cm H2O before inspiration and −12 cm H2O the end of inspiration. What is the compliance of the lungs?

The clinical laboratory returned the following values for arterial blood taken from a patient: plasma pH = 7.28, plasma HCO3 = 32 mEq/L, and plasma PCO2 = 70 mm Hg. What is this patient’s acid–base disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute respiratory acidosis without renal compensation

options.label: B
options.text: Respiratory acidosis with partial renal compensation

options.label: C
options.text: Acute metabolic acidosis without respiratory compensation

options.label: D
options.text: Metabolic acidosis with partial respiratory compensation

questions.correct_answer: B. Respiratory acidosis with partial renal compensation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Respiratory acidosis with partial renal compensation

questions.text: In acidosis, most of the hydrogen ions secreted by the proximal tubule are associated with which of the following processes?
The volume–pressure curves shown in the next diagram were obtained from a young, healthy subject and a patient. Which of the following best describes the condition of the patient?
Which of the following is not a measure of stroke volume?

options.label: A
options.text: Left ventricular end diastolic volume minus left ventricular end systolic volume

options.label: B
options.text: Ejection fraction times left ventricular end diastolic volume

questions.correct_answer: C. Ejection fraction times cardiac output
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Ejection fraction times cardiac output

questions.text: For a sensory nerve fiber that is connected to a Pacinian corpuscle located on palmar surface of the right hand, the synaptic connection with the subsequent neuron in the corresponding sensory pathway is located in.

options.label: C
options.text: The dorsal horn of the right side of the spinal cord

options.label: D
options.text: The dorsal horn of the left side of the spinal cord

questions.correct_answer: A. The right dorsal column nucleus
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The right dorsal column nucleus

questions.text: Which one of the following membrane has highest protein content per gram of tissue?
Identify the correct statement amongst the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Female has less body water content due to more bone mass

options.label: B
options.text: Male has more body water content due to more fat

options.label: C
options.text: Infant has more body water content due to high bone mass

options.label: D
options.text: Infant has more body water content due to less fat

questions.correct_answer: D. Infant has more body water content due to less fat
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Infant has more body water content due to less fat

questions.text: Which one of the following are used in calculating the serum osmolarity? 1. Serum sodium 2. Glucose 3. Calcium 4. Blood urea nitrogen

In a patient with malignant hyperthermia triggered by anesthesia, which of the following alterations in the process of excitation-contraction (EC) coupling is primarily responsible for the rapid onset of muscle rigidity and hyperthermia?

options.label: A
options.text: Inactivity of L-type calcium channels in the sarcolemma

options.label: B
options.text: Overactivity of calcium channels in the sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR)

options.label: C
options.text: Impaired release of acetylcholine at the neuromuscular junction

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced activity of voltage-gated sodium channels in the muscle membrane

questions.correct_answer: B. Overactivity of calcium channels in the sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR)

questions.text: Assertion: In absolute refractory period, the nerve cannot be stimulated even with a strong stimulus Reason: Majority of the sodium channels are in inactivated state during the early part of the refractory period Identify the correct statement from the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Both the assertion and the reason statements are correct, the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both the assertion and the reason statements are correct, the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: The assertion statement is incorrect, but the reason statement is correct

options.label: D
options.text: Both the assertion and the reason statements are incorrect

questions.correct_answer: A. Both the assertion and the reason statements are correct, the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Both the assertion and the reason statements are correct, the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion

questions.text: Where do afferent fibers from baroreceptors primarily project for blood pressure control?
Match the following steps of ventricular action potential in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A-2, B-3, C-4, D-1, E-5

questions.text: In a patient, the hypothalamic thermostat was reset from point V to point X as shown below. Which of the following happens in stage Y compared to stage W?

A 63-year-old male with a history of ischemic cardiomyopathy presents to the emergency department with acute onset of dizziness, marked hypotension, and bradycardia after taking an intravenous herbal supplement he found online. The emergency team, suspecting a potential reflex activation due to an unknown compound in the supplement, reminiscent of the effects seen with Veratrum alkaloids, which one of the following is true regarding the same reflex?

options.label: A
options.text: Activation of carotid body chemoreceptors leads to the reflex condition.

options.label: B
options.text: Stimulation of aortic arch stretch receptors induces the reflex.

options.label: C
options.text: Chemical stimulation of left ventricular receptors triggers the Bezold-Jarisch reflex.

options.label: D
options.text: Peripheral vasodilation by direct action on vascular smooth muscle initiates the reflex.

questions.correct_answer: C. Chemical stimulation of left ventricular receptors triggers the Bezold-Jarisch reflex.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Chemical stimulation of left ventricular receptors triggers the Bezold-Jarisch reflex.

questions.text: Which curve among the following represents the production of Beta-globin chains?
Pulmonary compliance is?

options.label: B
options.text: Defined as the change in pressure per unit change in volume.

options.label: C
options.text: Slightly greater when measured during deflation than when measured during inflation

questions.correct_answer: C. Slightly greater when measured during deflation than when measured during inflation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Slightly greater when measured during deflation than when measured during inflation

questions.text: Preload is the stretching of the cardiac muscle fibres at the end of diastole, just before contraction. It is due to an increase in ventricular pressure caused by the filling of blood during diastole. An image is provided below that further supplements the findings stated above. These are expressions of?

A 35-year-old man visits his doctor because his wife has complained of his snoring. He undergoes polysomnography and ventilatory response testing to ascertain the extent and cause of his sleep apnea. The activity of the central chemoreceptors is stimulated by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: A decrease in the metabolic rate of the surrounding brain tissue

options.label: B
options.text: A decrease in the PO2 of blood flowing through the brain

options.label: C
options.text: An increase in the PCO2 of blood flowing through the brain

options.label: D
options.text: An increase in the pH of the CSF

questions.correct_answer: C. An increase in the PCO2 of blood flowing through the brain
questions.explanation: Ans. C) An increase in the PCO2 of blood flowing through the brain

questions.text: In a patient presenting with a suspected gastrointestinal motility disorder, an endoscopic biopsy reveals alterations of Dense bodies in smooth muscle tissue. This is found at a specific site within smooth muscle cells is associated with the attachment of actin filaments and contributes to the contractile function. This altered structure is analogous to which structure found in skeletal muscle?
A motorcyclist suffered head injury 6 months back and presents with persistent memory deficits following injury. Choose the most appropriately matched option related to memory?
questions.correct_answer: C. Medial temporal lobe- Declarative memory
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Medial temporal lobe - Declarative memory

questions.text: Which one of the following clinical disorder specifically arises due to the defective functioning of aquaporins, notably AQP2, crucial for water reabsorption in the kidney tubules, which disrupts the kidney's ability to concentrate urine, resulting in an excessive urine output, thirst, and potential dehydration despite adequate fluid intake.
Many signalling pathways involve the generation of inositol trisphosphate (IP3) and diacylglycerol (DAG). These molecules:

Which characteristic physiological response pattern is associated with a pulmonary reflex mechanism stimulated by the activation of pulmonary J-receptors, specifically related to the release of inflammatory mediators or pulmonary congestion in conditions such as pulmonary edema or interstitial lung disease?
Which of the following is/are properties of ventricular muscle fibers: 1. All or none law 2. Length tension relation 3. Tetanus 4. Long refractory period
Erythropoietin is produced by: a. Kidney b. Liver c. Spleen d. Lung Select the correct answer given below code:
During submandibular gland tumor removal lingual nerve was found to be damaged. Which of the following statement is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Taste sensation of posterior one-third of tongue is lost.

options.label: B
options.text: Taste sensation of anterior two-third of tongue is lost.

options.label: C
options.text: General sensation of posterior one-third of tongue is lost.

options.label: D
options.text: General sensation of anterior two-third of tongue is lost.

questions.correct_answer: D. General sensation of anterior two-third of tongue is lost.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) General sensation of anterior two-third of tongue is lost.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the AV nodal delay?

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibits the depolarization of the atrial chambers

options.label: C
options.text: Facilitates the atrial contraction ahead of ventricles

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibits the repolarization of the ventricles

questions.correct_answer: C. Facilitates the atrial contraction ahead of ventricles
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Facilitates the atrial contraction ahead of ventricles

questions.text: The velocity of the blood flow will be the lowest in which part of the circulatory system?
Which of the following factors is/are involved in the calculation of the Reynolds number? 1. Density 2. Diameter 3. Velocity 4. Viscosity

A 60-year-old male with a history of controlled hypertension is undergoing an echocardiographic evaluation as part of his routine follow-up. The echo reveals an end-systolic volume (ESV) of 70 mL and an end-diastolic volume (EDV) of 130 mL. His resting cardiac output, measured by thermodilution during the same procedure, is reported as 5 L/min. What is this patient's stroke volume?

In a patient with a known bleeding disorder, dysfunction of which cellular organelle responsible for intracellular packaging could potentially result in impaired secretion of clotting factors and other crucial proteins?
Identify the type of transport across the cell membrane represented below:
Which among the following has the highest airway resistance?
All of the following ions have maximum reduction in their concentration on the luminal side of proximal convoluted tubule except:
Fetal hemoglobin has higher affinity for oxygen due to:

options.label: D
options.text: Oxygen dissociation curve is shifted to right

questions.text: A 62-year-old woman eats a high carbohydrate meal. Her plasma glucose concentration rises, and this results in increased insulin secretion from the pancreatic islet cells. Glucose mediated insulin release is mediated through:

Assume that excess blood is transfused into a patient whose arterial baroreceptors are nonfunctional and blood pressure increases from 100 to 175 mm Hg. Then, assume that the same volume of blood is infused into the same patient under conditions where his arterial baroreceptors are functioning normally and blood pressure increases from 100 to 125 mm Hg. What is the approximate feedback “gain” of the arterial baroreceptors in this patient when they are functioning normally?
If the membrane potential of this cell is −80 millivolts, the driving force is greatest for which ion?

Physical examination of a 41-year-old narcotic abuser reveals an early systolic murmur. The physician also notes a 7 cm distance between the height of the blood in his right internal jugular vein and the sternal angle (normal = 3 cm). Which of the following conditions is most likely responsible for the physical findings?

A patient with chronic kidney disease presents with elevated serum potassium levels. Despite treatment, the patient remains at risk of hyperkalemia due to impaired renal excretion. The compartment of body fluid which is primarily responsible for potassium regulation, what percentage does it represent as compared to Extracellular fluid?
Countercurrent mechanism is present in which of the following parts of the body? 1. Eye 2. Testes 3. Kidney 4. Gut 5. Skin
What leads to the detachment of myosin from actin filaments during muscle contraction?

options.label: B
options.text: Cessation of calcium release from sarcoplasm

options.label: D
options.text: Attachment of ATP to myosin head

questions.correct_answer: D. Attachment of ATP to myosin head
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Attachment of ATP to myosin head

questions.text: Which of the following statements are incorrect about vasopressin?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a more powerful vasoconstrictor than angiotensin II.

options.label: B
options.text: Concentration of circulating blood vasopressin after severe hemorrhage can increase enough to attenuate reductions in arterial pressure markedly.

options.label: C
options.text: Uses adenylyl cyclase-cAMP as well as phospholipase C system.

options.label: D
options.text: Secreted by paraventricular nucleus of hypothalamus.

questions.correct_answer: D. Secreted by paraventricular nucleus of hypothalamus.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Secreted by paraventricular nucleus of hypothalamus.

questions.text: Which of the following is the incorrect match?

options.label: A
options.text: Gastrin from G cells from stomach

options.label: B
options.text: Motilin from Mo cells from duodenum and jejunum

options.label: C
options.text: CCK from K cell of duodenum and pancreas

options.label: D
options.text: Secretin from S cells of duodenum and jejunum

questions.correct_answer: C. CCK from K cell of duodenum and pancreas
questions.explanation: Ans. C) CCK from K cell of duodenum and pancreas

questions.text: Most common cause of iron deficiency anemia is lack of dietary intake of iron. Iron is transported from enterocyte to capillary through:
The hypothalamus and fat tissues also play an important role in the regulation of energy metabolism Leptin acts by increasing the activity of:
Which of the following hormone is reported to promote maturation of hypothalamic gonadal axis during puberty?
The migrating motor complex in humans:

options.label: A
options.text: Occurs only in the small intestine

options.label: B
options.text: Requires an intact intrinsic nervous system for coordinated propagation

options.label: C
options.text: Is the result of food-mediated distension of the small intestine

options.label: D
options.text: Mixes intestinal contents with bile and the digestive enzymes

questions.correct_answer: B. Requires an intact intrinsic nervous system for coordinated propagation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Requires an intact intrinsic nervous system for coordinated propagation

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a history of hypertension and hypercholesterolemia presents to your office for a routine cardiovascular examination. During auscultation, you note a prominent heart sound immediately following the T-wave on the ECG. Referring to the heart sound indicated by the purple arrow in the provided phonocardiogram, what is the most likely cause of this sound?
A 55yrs old smoker having difficulty in breathing was diagnosed with pulmonary lung fibrosis has saturation of 89%. The cause of this reduced saturation is defect in which mechanism?

In skin the somatosensory receptors work as a transducers, which convert various types of sensation into electrical energy and sent the signals to the brain. One of them is onion shaped corpuscles present in dermis. It detects which one of the following property?

A 32 year male patient comes to the OPD with the complain of diffuse pain in abdomen from last 3 hours. While history taking he tells the attending physician that he ate street food last night. This sensation is transmitted by:
Which of the following regarding actions on plasma Ca++ and PO4- is true?

According to Fick’s law of the diffusion is not proportional to?
Identify the sleep wave marked in the EEG during sleep wake cycle?
Which of the following diagnosis can be inferred from the graph given below?
All are true about Decerebrate posture EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Extension of both upper and lower extremity

options.label: B
options.text: Flexion of upper extremity and extension of lower extremity

options.label: D
options.text: Reticulo spinal tract is also involved

questions.correct_answer: B. Flexion of upper extremity and extension of lower extremity
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Flexion of upper extremity and extension of lower extremity

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient presents with coordination difficulties and unsteady gait, suggesting potential involvement of the cerebellar hemispheres involved in planning of movement. In the context of this patient's symptoms and the cerebellum, which of the following structures represents the most lateral part of the cerebellar hemispheres?
In a patient with suspected endocrine dysfunction, which hormone primarily acts through the signaling pathway shown in the diagram below, potentially contributing to the patient's condition?
The second phase of saliva secretion involves:

options.label: A
options.text: Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, passive K+ secretion, active secretion of HC03-

options.label: B
options.text: Passive Na+ reabsorption, active CI- reabsorption, passive K+ secretion, active secretion of HCO3-

options.label: C
options.text: Passive Na+ secretion, active CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-

options.label: D
options.text: Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-

questions.correct_answer: D. Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-

questions.text: A and B in the graph below represent which of the following ions, in terms of permeability for action potential generation:

options.label: A
options.text: A is Na+, B is K+

options.label: B
options.text: A is Na+, B is Ca2+

options.label: C
options.text: A is K+, B is Ca2+

options.label: D
options.text: A is Ca2+, B is K+

questions.correct_answer: A. A is Na+, B is K+
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A is Na+, B is K+

questions.text: A 40-year-old patient is recovering from a traumatic brain injury, and their medical team is monitoring the clearance of cellular debris and damaged neurons. In the context of this patient's recovery and the human brain, which type of cells are primarily involved in the phagocytosis and removal of debris in the central nervous system?
Which of the following are secreted from the parietal cells of the stomach? 1. Mucous 2. Hydrochloric acid 3. Gastrin 4. Intrinsic factor

A 68-year-old woman with hematemesis has heart burn and stomach pain. An endoscopy shows inflammation involving the gastric body and antrum as well as a small gastric ulcer. Biopsies were positive for H. pylori. H. pylori damages the gastric mucosa primarily by increasing mucosal levels of which of the following?

A 22-year-old woman presents with symptoms of increased heart rate and sweating after receiving a beta-adrenergic agonist. The effects of the drug are mediated by a second messenger system. Which of the following correctly describes the intracellular signaling cascade triggered by beta-adrenergic receptor activation?
